page.title: 17Hayle Towans.
page.content: The Towans are{grassy sand}dunes.They were formed when we had a huge storm in the 1800s and from them you can see most of Hayle.On the way to the Towans we passed a river which is polluted by metal and factory waste.The stones which built the bridge are made of copper slag. The land by the bridge is marshy.When we went through the graveyard there were lots of childrens graves.The ground by the graveyard is stony and dusty but on the Towans the ground is very soft.I could see the recreation ground,J & F Pool's (a factory),the Rugby Club,a lot of fields and the industrial estate.Some people say that there is a village buried under part of the Towans. There are{holiday camps}and caravan parks there.
